item.title: Typing my pass instead of root in GNOME
item.description:
I'm an avid fan of using sudo when needed and avoiding typing my root password. In the command-line this works fairly easy:

su -
usermod -a -G wheel MYUSERNAME
visudo
# Uncomment the following line:
%wheel  ALL=(ALL)       ALL

item.title: On criticism
item.description: Great project leaders not only accept criticism, they encourage it. They understand that their project’s worst enemy is stagnation, which comes from apathy, oppression, and not enough feedback.
